roles: Prime Minister of Thailand
supporting_quotes: politician who served as the Prime Minister of Thailand for two terms, first from 1991 to 1992 and again for a brief period during the latter half of 1992.

roles: Ambassador of Thailand to the United Nations
supporting_quotes: Anand spent 23 years in the foreign service, serving at times as the Ambassador of Thailand to the United Nations, Canada, the United States, and West Germany.

supporting_quotes: He became the Vice-Chairman of the Saha-Union Group in 1979

roles: Director of Siam Commercial Bank
supporting_quotes: He has been a Director of Siam Commercial Bank since 1984

roles: Chairman of the Board of Directors
supporting_quotes: He became the Chairman of the Board of Directors in 1991

roles: Member of the Constitution Drafting Assembly
Chairman of the Drafting Committee
supporting_quotes: In 1996, Anand was elected as a member of the Constitution Drafting Assembly and was appointed Chairman of the Drafting Committee.

roles: Chairman of the National Reconciliation Commission (NRC)
supporting_quotes: From March 2005, Anand served as chairman of the National Reconciliation Commission (NRC), tasked with overseeing that peace was restored to the troubled south.

roles: UNICEF Ambassador for Thailand
supporting_quotes: Anand served as UNICEF Ambassador for Thailand since 1996.

roles: Chair the High-Level Panel on Threats, Challenges and Change
supporting_quotes: During November 2003 and December 2004, Anand was requested by then United Nations Secretary-General Kofi Annan to chair the High-Level Panel on Threats, Challenges and Change of the United Nations.
